result.execSummary:
The defendant Peggy A. STANZEL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To Harvey Clark to be paid at a minimum of $500.00 per month.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to make a full financial disclosure statement to the Department of Corrections in order for them to assess and monitor her finances.

Defendant is to have no contact with Harvey Clark unless approved by her agent and approved by Harvey.

Send apology letter to the victim after its approved by the agent.

Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any gaming.

Defendant is to have no contact with any establishment/facilities which offer any gaming or gambling or any sort.

Provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peggy A. STANZEL

Duplicate original delivered to DOC.

records.addlTxt: Letter from ADA Vendetti to Judge Bendix dated 07-23-15.
Not guilty verdicts - unsigned.
GUILTY verdicts for all five counts.
Exhibits 80 through 99.

JURY TRIAL - DAY TWO
Testimony Continues.
Exhibits 80 through 99, marked, offered and received.
The defendant is found GUILTY of all five counts by the jury.
State moves for judgments on the verdicts.
The Court receives the verdict and grants the State's motion.  The Court enters judgment of conviction on all five counts.
Bail is continued.
Sentencing hearing is set for 07-28-15 at 9:00 a.m.
Minutes.
Exhibits 1 through 79.
Courtroom Jury List.
Random Listing of Jurors.

ISSUES PRIOR TO TRIAL- 
Attorney Vendetti requests a change in the language in the preliminary instruction regarding the theft charge to state she intentionally used instead of intentionally take and carry away.
Regarding the testimony of Mr. Nelson, the Court believes the question of methodology will be used for the legitimate purpose of cross-examination regarding honesty and his knowledge and goes toward credibility of the witness.  The Court will allow that testimony subject to question by question objection.
Attorney Vendetti states the language in the preliminary instruction regarding the forgery charges do not reflect the language in the Amended Information and requests the language be changed.
JURY TRIAL - DAY ONE
Jury selected.
Testimony presented.
Exhibits 1 through 79 marked, offered and received.
Minutes.

Proposed Verdict forms.
Cover letter.
Amended Information charging one count theft, contrary to Section 943.20(1)(a) and four counts forgery, contrary to Section 943.38(1).

Order on Defense's Motions in Limine.  
Cover Letter.

Order Regarding State's Motions in Limine.
Based on the reasons stated on the record July 1, 2015, the Court orders the following regarding he State's Motions in Limine:
1.  Motions #1, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13 are granted.
2.  Motions #2,3, 4, and 5 are granted, with the modification of the date September 8, 2014 to be July 1, 2015.  
3.  Motion #15 is granted in part and denied in part.   Specifically, the motion with regard to introduction of the evidence under sec. 904.04, Wis. Stats., is denied and the motion with regard to introduction of the evidence under sec. 906.08, Wis. Stats., is granted.
4.  Ruling on Motion #8 is reserved until trial.  
Cover Letter.

Court hears counsel's pre-trial motions and motion's in limine.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.
Notice of Appearance.

Petition and Order for Appointment of Counsel;  Affidavit of Indigency.
This petition is denied because the court finds the defendant is not indigent.

Defendant does not qualify for the public defender and files a Petition for Appointment of Counsel with the Court.  The Court reviews it and denies it, finding the defendant not indigent.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 02-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that she have no contact with Harvey Clark and that she report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.

RE:  Harvey Clark, between 06-12-07 and 04-24-09.
Initial appearance is set for 02-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.
